DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Dose Change Reason ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The rationale for changing the substance administration in relation to the previous substance administration. EXAMPLE(S): dose reduced due to hematologic toxicity

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Dose Change Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
